Well, here's a weird thing.
Massachusetts has this very old legal principle called "abatement ab initio".
It means, from the beginning, it essentially means if a person has not exhausted all of their appeals
everything they can do legally, and they die; their case reverts back to the status at the beginning.
Before the trial, before the conviction.
That means potentially even though Hernandez was found guilty for murder
because he did not exhaust all his appeals in the state of Massachusetts
in the eyes of the government he may technically be viewed as an innocent man.
